Pre-Game Insights: England require a win against Bangladesh to get their World Cup campaign up-and-running after suffering a surprise opening round thrashing at the hands of New Zealand.
Lose, and England will pretty much need to win all seven of their remaining matches to make the semi-finals.
Bangladesh started their campaign with a tidy win over Afghanistan and will by no means be a pushover.
The match being held in the stunning Dharmasala, where spin plays much less of a role, will favour England's arsenal of quick bowlers.
England may leave out the spin of Moeen Ali and pick one of Gus Atkinson, David Willey or Reece Topley as an extra seamer.
Ben Stokes is expected to remain unavailable whilst he recovers from a hip injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: You can watch the match live on Sky Sports Cricket and Main Event from 5:30am.
Sky Sports customers can live stream the match via the Sky Go app on a variety of devices including most smartphones and tablets as part of their subscription.
You can also watch the match via NOW without signing up to a contract.
NOW can be streamed through a computer or apps found on most smart TVs, phones and consoles. NOW is also available via TNT Sports.
You can listen to the match on BBC Radio 5 Sports Extra, which is available on DAB radio or you can tune into the station via most TV packages.
You can also listen to Radio 5 Sports Extra via the BBC Sounds app, or online via the BBC Sport website and app.
